page.title: 14FURZE HILL - A VANTAGE POINT
page.content: Furze Hill is the highest point in the area and from the top you can see most of the island. My class visited the hill recently and to the south we could see the Swale, which separates the Isle of Sheppey from the mainland, and Sheppey's only link,the Kingsferry Bridge. To the east we could see the town of Queenborough, which seems to be surrounded by imported,parked cars, and to the north-east, Sheerness Docks, from which the Olau Line ferry was sailing to Holland. To the north we could see the towns of Bluetown and Sheerness and in the far distance, across the Thames estuary, the Essex town of Southend. To the west we could see the village of Minster with Minster Abbey at the top of the hill, and to the south-west, in the distance across the marshes, we could see Eastchurch Prison. Stephen Carr.
